Lunarpine fealt something going through his head. A sort of feeling 
like when he had Shadow Wings Spark inside him. He tried to quicken 
the pace but walking on 2 legs was harder than he thjought it would 
be. He got another idea. "Veratis" He called over his comm, "Send my 
transport pod to me."

Foxfingers reached the entrance to the base when his comm intercepted 
the message. "I'm nearby, I'll take it to him." The fox didn't know 
who was speaking but if Veratis vouched for him then he was an allie.

"No" Veratis shouted, "Ice is contaminated with the virus." He 
continued yelling for Foxfingers to keep his distance until the 
drones cleaned up.

The Maximal transport launched by remote control. Lunarpine waited 
patiently for it hoping that it wasn't to late.

--- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, logomorph@h... wrote:
> Ice::
> 
> She heard Lunarpine's thoughts. She wasn't quite sure what he ment. 
> She scanned his mind and saw just what the virus was and what it 
> could do.  She felt fearful now.  She had thoughts about what would 
> happen if the got into a battle and her blood was spilt. It could 
> endanger the planet. She was now a threat. Her worst fear was 
> starting to come true before her eyes. She would no longer ba able 
to 
> fight with Lunarpine, she would have to be caged and kept under 
lock 
> and key as long as she had this virus in her. Her body started to 
> shake as fear started to flood her mind.
> 
> 
> --- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, cyberwolf4@p... wrote:
> > Lunarpine smelled the dripping blood and knew that he had to get 
> Ice 
> > back to base quickly. He caught another scent on the wind, 
another 
> > wolf. He knew how to handle this though. He snarled loudly as a 
> sign 
> > to the scavenger that this was his prize. He knew from pack 
> instincts 
> > that the other wolf would recognize Lunarpines size strength, and 
> > health as a sign of dominance. Ice wasn't on the menu tonight.
> > 
> > 
> > The clean up drones continued to take care of the virus infected 
> > blood. Lunarpine watched as they dusted through his footprints 
> > cleaning up all traces of blood. "I don't know if you know this 
or 
> > not but you just came close to ending us all." He knew he was 
> immune, 
> > he also knew that if the virus would've gotten out that every 
> faction 
> > on this tiny little world would hunt them down and force them to 
> > share the same fate.
> >
